definitions.title: n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: (√ dub.; Thes MV al. der. fr. [[חָמָה]], [[חֲמָת]] = fortress, or (v. RS:Sem. i, 140), sacred enclosure, temenos, ḥimā, cf. Hal:JAS 7 ême Sêr. x, 392, Lag:BN 82, 156; but no certainty that name is Shemitic; Ar. h.ama0h;, As. Amattu, Dl:PA 275 ff. Pr 174);—mod. Ḥamâ, on el-‘A‘ṣi (Orontes), 38 h. (c. 115 m.) N. of Damascus, v. Bd:Pal 398 f. It had a king, [[תּׂעִי]], in David's time 2Sa 8:9 = 1Ch 18:9, and in 8th cent. B.C. 2 K 2Ki 19:13 = Is 37:13; gods of its own 2Ki 17:30, 2Ki 18:34 = Is 36:19; gave its name to land (limits unknown) ´[[רִבְלָה בְּאֶרֶץ ח]] 2Ki 23:33, 2Ki 25:21, Je 39:5, Je 52:9, Je 52:27, cf. 2Ch 8:4; contained Isr. exiles Is 11:11; furnished colonists for Samaria 2Ki 17:24 (cf. v:2Ki 17:30 supr.) after being conquered by Sargon, (COT 2Ki 17:24, 2Ki 18:34 cf. Is 10:9). It is called great Hamath by Am 6:2 ([[חֲמַת רַבָּה]], —[[חֲמַת]] only here). ´[[ח]] is mentioned with [[דַּמֶּשֶׂק]], [[חׂר]], [[חִידוֹן]] in prophecy against land Hadrach ([[חַדְרָךְ]]) Zec 9:2, cf. Je 49:23. Often in phr. ´[[לְבאׂ ח]] ([[עַד־]]) = the entrance to H., i.e. the approach to H., as territorial limit Ju Jdg 3:3; usu. as denoting (ideal) northern limit of Isr. territory Jos 13:5, Nu 13:21, Nu 34:8, Am 6:14, 1Ki 8:65 = 2Ch 7:8, 2Ki 14:25, 1Ch 13:5; [[חֲמָָתָה]] 1Ch 18:3; [[חובָה]] ´[[ח]] 2Ch 8:3, and [[הֵשִׁיב]] [[לִיחוּדָה]] ´[[אֶת־דַּמֶּשֶׂק וְאֶת־ח]] 2Ki 14:28; so also Ez Eze 47, Eze 48: ´[[גְּבוּל ח]] Ez Eze 47:17, cf. v:Eze 47:16 b + v:Eze 47:16 a (del. Co); ´[[לְבוֹא ח]] Eze 48:1, cf. Eze 47:20; ´[[אֶל־יַד ח]] Eze 48:1.
